title: Shrikhand (flavoured hung yoghurt)

ingredients.content: 200 g fresh mango cheeks (approx. 1 mango), cut into pieces
80 g pistachio nuts, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Line a large sieve (1.5L capacity) with a nut milk bag or muslin cloth and place over a large bowl. Place a separate bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh yoghurt into it. Transfer yoghurt into lined sieve and place into refrigerator to drain for 12-24 hours, until thick and creamy.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh water into it. Add saffron and set aside to soak for 10 minutes.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Place strained yoghurt curd, saffron with soaking water, cardamom, mango and sugar into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk.<b>

Transfer into serving bowls and garnish with chopped pistachios. If not serving immediately, transfer into a sealable container and place into refrigerator until ready to serve. Garnish with pistachios before serving.

hintsAndTricks: The whey which drained from the yoghurt can be used in smoothies, soups and baking.
If fresh mango is not available, use thawed frozen mango, or replace with strawberries.
Shrikhand is also great for breakfast, with muesli if desired.
